intro: Pityrocarpa obliqua, commonly known as the oblique pittosporum, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the family Pittosporaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, with a glossy appearance, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. The fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat.
